required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Misoprostol for Management of Women With an Incomplete Miscarriage
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Study Between Two Doses of Misoprostol in Women With Incomplete First-trimester Miscarriage After Misoprostol Treatment: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Miscarriage is defined as the spontaneous loss of a pregnancy before 24 weeks gestation, that is, before fetal viability. The clinical signs of miscarriage are usually vaginal bleeding associated with abdominal pain and cramping. The miscarriage is named 'complete' or 'incomplete' according to whether or not tissues are retained in the uterus. If a woman has minimal bleeding but her cervix is closed, this is known as a 'threatened miscarriage. However; if the pregnancy is still inside the uterus but the cervix is open, this is described as an 'inevitable miscarriage', which it will not usually be possible to save the fetus.

detailed_description.textblock: the aim of the study is to evaluate 2 doses with misoprostol in Women With Incomplete First-trimester Miscarriage After Misoprostol Treatment

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The number of patients with complete miscarriage at 1 week
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients with complete miscarriage at 1 week

arm_group.description: received misoprostol 800 µg (Misotac 200 µg tablets, SIGMA pharmaceutical) once dose sublingually
received misoprostol 400 µg (Misotac 200 µg tablets, SIGMA pharmaceutical) once dose sublingually

intervention.description: received misoprostol 800 µg (Misotac 200 µg tablets, SIGMA pharmaceutical) once dose sublingually
received misoprostol 400 µg (Misotac 200 µg tablets, SIGMA pharmaceutical) once dose sublingually

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women with confirmed incomplete induced miscarriage, less than 12 weeks' gestation.
- No known allergy to misoprostol.
- Women who will be hemodynamically stable.
- Good access to emergency facilities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with signs of severe infection ( fever > 38°)
- Women with severe vaginal bleeding
- Women are known to have allergies to prostaglandins
- Severe abdominal pain requiring immediate intervention
